projects.description: Tax Tracker is a web application that I created while attending a coding bootcamp. Its main objective is to help contract workers like Uber and Lyft track their mileages, expenses and taxes. To build this project I used figma to create the wireframing/prototype, then based on the figma prototype I created the template with HTML and CSS, and finally I used the template the help me create the vue for each react components.

Courses Libray is a React application that manages and displays a list of courses from an api. The api is built with Express and MongoDB and it allows users to create, update and delete courses. On the client unauthenticated users can see all listed courses but they can't add or edit any course but once users are authenticated they can create, update and delete any course they have created.

Public Api Request is an application that displays a list of random profiles from the random user api. In this project, I used the fetch api to request 12 random profiles asynchronously from the (randomuser.com api) and I used DOM manipulation to render the employee data to the browser in card tile format. Each card can be clicked to show a modal view that displays more information about the user.

Pagination List is an application that takes a list of studentsâ€™ profiles and displays them in a pagination format, making it easier to browse through the list. The list is dynamically formatted upon loading to show ten students profile per page.

Interactive Form is mostly written in Jquery. The purpose of the form is to register users for an event. The form uses Jquery to do most of the DOM manipulation. The form use Regex is to validate all inputs. The form provides feedback messages with instruction when user input or is invalid.
Phrase Hunter is a game that allows players to guess random phrases by guessing letter each character in the phrase.
Random Quote is an application that randomly displays a list of 7 quotes at 25 seconds interval while also randomly changing the background color.
